info.title: Steel API
info.description:
Steel (https://steel.dev) is an open-source browser API purpose-built for AI agents.
        
It offers endpoints for various browser actions and session management, enabling agents to navigate the web for information over long running browser sessions.
    
**Key Capabilities:**
- Control fleets of browser sessions in the cloud via API or Python/Node SDKs
- Easily extract page data as cleaned HTML, markdown, PDFs, or screenshots
- Access data behind logins with persistent cookies and automatic sign-in
- Render complex client-side content with JavaScript execution
- Bypass anti-bot measures with rotating proxies, stealth configs, and CAPTCHA solving
- Reduce token usage and costs by up to 80% with optimized page formats
- Reuse session and cookie data across multiple runs
- Debug with ease using live session viewers, replays, and embeddings

**Target Audience:**
- AI engineers and developers working with online LLMs
- Users with their own infrastructure looking to offload browser hosting operations
- Users who need to scrape the web for information
- QA teams who need to test web applications

**Get Started:**
- Open-source: Available as a Docker container for easy integration and scaling
- Cloud API: Fully hosted and managed, no setup required. Get an API key at https://steel.dev
- SDK: Available in Python, JavaScript, and more

**Documentation:**
- Check out the full documentation at https://docs.steel.dev
- Explore the SDK documentation to get started with your project
- Join our community on Discord for support and discussions

CreateSessionRequest.title: createSessionRequest

sessionId.description: Optional custom UUID for the session

userAgent.description: Custom user agent string for the browser session

useProxy.description: Enable Steel-provided residential proxy usage for the browser session. Default is false, which routes requests through datacenter proxies.

proxyUrl.description: Custom proxy URL for the browser session. Overrides useProxy, disabling Steel-provided proxies in favor of your specified proxy. Format: http(s)://username:password@hostname:port

blockAds.description: Block ads in the browser session. Default is false.

solveCaptcha.description: Enable automatic captcha solving. Default is false.

httpOnly.description: Whether the cookie is HTTP only

sameSite.description: The same site attribute of the cookie

expires.description: The expiration date of the cookie

topLevelSite.description: The site of the top-level URL the browser was visiting at the start of the request to the endpoint that set the cookie.

hasCrossSiteAncestor.description: Indicates if the cookie has any ancestors that are cross-site to the topLevelSite.

partitionKey.description: The partition key of the cookie

session.description: Whether the cookie is a session cookie

sameParty.description: Whether the cookie is a same party cookie

sourceScheme.description: The source scheme of the cookie

sourcePort.description: The source port of the cookie

cookies.description: Cookies to initialize in the session

localStorage.description: Domain-specific localStorage items to initialize in the session

sessionStorage.description: Domain-specific sessionStorage items to initialize in the session

indexedDB.description: Domain-specific indexedDB items to initialize in the session

sessionContext.description: Session context data to be used in the created session. Sessions will start with an empty context by default.

timeout.description: Session timeout duration in milliseconds. Default is 300000 (5 minutes).

concurrency.description: Number of sessions to create concurrently (check your plan limit)

isSelenium.description: Enable Selenium mode for the browser session (default is false). Use this when you plan to connect to the browser session via Selenium.

dimensions.description: Viewport and browser window dimensions for the session

namespace.description: The namespace the session should be created against. Defaults to "default".

region.description: The desired region for the session to be started in

CreateSessionRequest.description: Request body schema for creating a new browser session.

NullableRequest.title: nullableRequest
NullableRequest.description: Empty request body that can be null

url.description: URL of the webpage to scrape

format.description: Desired format(s) for the scraped content. Default is `html`.

screenshot.description: Include a screenshot in the response

pdf.description: Include a PDF in the response

useProxy.description: Use a Steel-provided residential proxy for the scrape

url.description: URL of the webpage to capture

useProxy.description: Use a Steel-provided residential proxy for capturing the screenshot

delay.description: Delay before capturing the screenshot (in milliseconds)

fullPage.description: Capture the full page screenshot. Default is `false`.

url.description: URL of the webpage to convert to PDF

useProxy.description: Use a Steel-provided residential proxy for generating the PDF

delay.description: Delay before generating the PDF (in milliseconds)

file.description: The file to upload (binary) or URL string to download from

path.description: Path to the file in the storage system

namespace.description: The namespace the credential is stored against. Defaults to "default".

origin.description: Website origin the credential is for

namespace.description: The namespace the credential is stored against. Defaults to "default".

origin.description: Website origin the credential is for

origin.description: Website origin the credential is for

namespace.description: The namespace the credential is stored against. Defaults to "default".

origin.description: Website origin the credential is for

createdAt.description: Date and time the credential was created

updatedAt.description: Date and time the credential was last updated

ErrorResponse.title: errorResponse
ErrorResponse.description: An error response from the API

SessionsResponse.title: sessionsResponse

duration.description: Duration of the session in milliseconds

eventCount.description: Number of events processed in the session

dimensions.description: Viewport and browser window dimensions for the session

creditsUsed.description: Amount of credits consumed by the session

websocketUrl.description: URL for the session's WebSocket connection

userAgent.description: User agent string used in the session

proxy.description: Proxy server used for the session

proxyBytesUsed.description: Amount of data transmitted through the proxy

solveCaptcha.description: Indicates if captcha solving is enabled

isSelenium.description: Indicates if Selenium is used in the session

region.description: The region where the session was created

items.description: Represents the data structure for a browser session, including its configuration and status.

SessionsResponse.description: Response containing a list of browser sessions with pagination details.

post.description: Extracts content from a specified URL.
Captures a screenshot of a specified webpage.
Generates a PDF from a specified webpage.

get.description: Fetches all active sessions for the current organization.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of sessions to return. Default is 50.

post.description: Creates a new session with the provided configuration.
Releases all active sessions for the current organization.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specific session by ID.
Fetches the context data of a specific session.
This endpoint allows you to get the recorded session events in the RRWeb format

post.description: Releases a specific session by ID.

get.description: Returns the live state of the session, including pages, tabs, and browser state

post.description: Uploads a file to a session via `multipart/form-data` with a `file` field that accepts either binary data or a URL string to download from, and an optional `path` field for the file storage path.

get.description: List all files from the session in descending order.

delete.description: Delete all files from a session

get.description: Download a file from a session

delete.description: Delete a file from a session

get.description: Download all files from the session as a zip archive.

post.description: Uploads a file to global storage via `multipart/form-data` with a `file` field that accepts either binary data or a URL string to download from, and an optional `path` field for the file storage path.

get.description: List all global files for the organization in descending order.
Download a file from global storage

delete.description: Delete a file from global storage

get.description: Fetches all credential metadata for the current organization.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: website origin the credential is for

post.description: Encrypts and stores credentials for an origin

put.description: Encrypts and updates credentials for an origin

delete.description: Deletes encrypted credentials from the database
